title: Understanding the Problem
text: To solve this problem, we need to understand how the volume of a gas changes with temperature. This is described by Charles's Law.

title: Charles's Law Formula
text: Charles's Law states that the volume of a gas is directly proportional to its temperature in Kelvin, given by the formula: $$\frac{V1}{T1}=\frac{V2}{T2}$$.

title: Convert Temperatures to Kelvin
text: To use Charles's Law, convert the temperatures from Celsius to Kelvin by adding $$273.15$$. So, $$17.0\degreeC$$ becomes $$290.15K$$ and $$34.0\degreeC$$ becomes $$307.15K$$.

title: Set Up the Equation
text: Using the formula $$\frac{V1}{T1}=\frac{V2}{T2}$$, substitute the known values: $$V1=2.30L$$, $$T1=290.15K$$, and $$T2=307.15K$$. Solve for V2.

title: Solve for V2
text: Rearrange the equation to solve for V2: $$V2=\frac{V1 T2}{T1}$$. Substitute the values to find V2.
